title: Is it wrong for me to respond?
body:
I am an avid reporter of toxic players. I hate them, they ruin my games. But after a while I just get pissed about it! Sometimes after telling people to chill out and stop being toxic, i will resort to just telling them to shut up, and mute them. But other times I know I can't afford to mute the team member because they DO give useful information and I DO want to win my games. Is it wrong for me to retaliate by telling them THEY are the ones playing bad, and ruining team fights? I usually say something like "You're the one being bad stop talking" or if I get really tilted off it I say "You're so stupid just stop talking and play".
My concern is if this is too much of myself being toxic in return? I know that I shouldn't say anything at all, but it just builds up when someone does it every game!{{champion:518}}

replies.body: Ever heard the phrase "dont feed the trolls"?
Someone said this to me once and it pissed me off like nothing else. He's legitimately trying to calm them down to win the game, this approach is the dumbest thing I've ever heard.
What.
Should I speak slowly?
You could try context and grammar, or more likely not.
You're right, I gotta just mute them right away when it starts. It just gets so bad in ranked sometimes I can't believe they still have an account when they act like that.
Stop caring what other people think.  Its pathetic.  Tell them what you think, or don't.  Who cares?  But if you care about your account, dont type, at all, ever or risk bans.
I don't care about what they think? I care that they are ruining my game and then inting because they are mad at the team.

Doesn't matter. Don;t use the chat. Got chat restricted and lost all chance of end of season rewards because I stood up for myself when a plat IV was talking down to me for being Bronze I. Don't use the chat because if you say "darn" the wrong way and someone gets "offended" by it then you will lose Honor levels and possibly more.

I know it's an automated system but I mean if you don't say anything flagged as offensive by it and are rarely reported will that really happen?? I mean the system can't be THAT broken, can it?

No. It won't. It's not broken.

You are getting replies on this thread from people that are salty about being correctly punished for toxic behavior.

If all you're doing is saying "shut up" once in a blue moon, it's **incredibly** unlikely you get punished. Only consistent *and/or* severe toxicity is punished. Rare frustration is not punished.
Oh, so OCCASIONAL harrasment is just fine now :).  Good to know where you stand.  :) :)
Harassment, by definition, is not "occasional".

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xmI9rrME,comment-id=0001000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-10T04:28:43.700+0000)
>
> Harassment, by definition, is not "occasional".

Sure it can be.  If something is occasional, and still occurs repeatedly, it can still be considered harassment.

https://puu.sh/ECNOF/e1235fc81a.png

https://puu.sh/ECNPl/3ca3b0f02b.png
Fine, I should have used the phrase "more than once" and occasionally, it is still harassment.

Saying "fuck you" once or twice is not harassment.

https://puu.sh/ECO16/ac790382a6.png

By definition, harassment must be **persistent** - i.e not occasional and not just "more than once".

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xmI9rrME,comment-id=00010000000100000000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2019-11-10T05:24:14.815+0000)

So if this is your logic, how is telling someone "KYS" once in a game,  verbal harassment?

I didn't ever say it was. You're actually the only one that used the word harassment until I had to define it for you. I said the following:

>If all you're doing is saying "shut up" once in a blue moon, it's incredibly unlikely you get punished. Only consistent and/or severe toxicity is punished. Rare frustration is not punished.

I never said that saying "kys" once is verbal harassment. I have said, however, that it is severe toxicity. Harassment is not the only thing punishable in League.
If it occurs repeatedly then its not occasional.
Fine, I should have used the phrase "more than once" and occasionally, it is still harassment.

That's good to know. If even small aggressions were punished like that I think I'd have been banned a long time ago. I used to be kind of toxic in ranked but I was just a teenager then though, and am much better now- and hopefully will never be up for a ban. :)

> Sadly in this game the people act like they have vaginas so yes it would be deemed as "toxic" However i always give them a piece of my mind because that what gaming really is about.

Is that what gaming is about? That's an interesting concept. I suppose next time I'm playing a _single player game_, I should start flaming the NPCs and being toxic to them.

Pretty sure gaming is about playing the game, and having fun. Not about trying to make other people feel bad, so they can't have fun.

I personally don't believe it's toxic, unless your chat becomes aggressive, or takes up game time.

The most effective thing I've figured out, is to literally say "you're being toxic", then just stop talking to them. It's good for you, and for that person. You see that they are toxic, so you now know to avoid them. They see you think they are toxic, so they have a time to reflect.
Most of the time, not always, the toxic people actually just stop.
The best part is, you're not flaming, you're not being toxic or rude, you're just making an observation and letting it go.
